text: A cultural icon can be a symbol, logo, picture, name, face, person, building, or other image. It is easily recognized and generally represents an object or idea with great cultural significance to a wide cultural group. It has a special status as representing, or important to, or loved by, a particular group of people, a place, or a period in history. In the media, many well- known examples of popular culture have been called "iconic". Some writers say that the word is overused.Heard about the famous icon? We have - far too often , The Independent (London), January 27, 2007 * See World Heritage Site #Cultural_criteria ==Icons and persons== Some of the most significant cultural icons include Whitney Houston, Marilyn Monroe, Elvis Presley, George Michael, James Dean, Che Guevara, Việt Hùng, Madonna, Jim Morrison, John Lennon, Michael Jackson, Frank Sinatra, Bob Marley, Kurt Cobain, the Beatles, Elizabeth Taylor, Walt Disney. ==Icons and brands== Brands can show social values and changes, but many people have become tired of them. Many brands want to be cultural icons, but fail. Cultural icons are often timeless, imprinted in our consciousness. They can go through several stages, from "rumblings, undercurrents" via "catharsis, explosion" and "mass acceptance, ripple effect" to "glorification, representative value". While brands are rational and driven by features, cultural icons are emotional, free, driven by feeling, and creating emotional bonds. An example of "branding" might include the wearing of a consistent fashion look by such music stars as Michael Jackson, Whitney Houston or Elvis Presley, making them instantly recognizable. Royal or church clothing could also be understood as a form of emotional iconography. Examples include: Andy Warhol, Budweiser, BMW, Chanel, Coca-Cola, Guinness, Harley-Davidson, LEGO, Martha Stewart, Nike, Norman Rockwell, Vuitton, Škoda Auto... ==Definition== Cultural icons may be national, regional or about a city. And they can be symbols for a nation, or can show the values held by that state. For example, France uses Marianne as a symbol of the French Revolution. Bruce Lee is a symbol for the martial arts and philosophical culture of insight and knowledge in the entire world. Charlie Chaplin symbolises comical action while Clint Eastwood is a symbol for strength and masculinity. Jackie Chan is a global icon of comical stunts and martial arts based action. Salvador Dalí is the worldwide icon for the bizarre and eccentric. ==Media overuse== Some writers say that the terms "icon" and "iconic" have been overused. A writer in Liverpool Daily Post calls "iconic" "a word that makes my flesh creep", a word "pressed into service to describe almost anything".Let's hear it for the Queen's English , Liverpool Daily Post The Christian Examiner added "iconic" and "amazing" to its list of overused words. It found over 18,000 "iconic" references in news stories alone, with another 30,000 for "icon", including use of it for SpongeBob SquarePants.Modern word usage amazingly leaves us yearning for gay, old times , Christian Examiner ==Icons by selected countries== ===Argentina=== File:Norma Aleandro.jpg|Norma Aleandro File:Eva&Juan.jpg;|Juan and Eva Perón File:Lionel Messi 20180626.jpg|Lionel Messi File:Maradona 1986 vs italy.jpg|Diego Maradona File:Mercedes Sosa, by Annemarie Heinrich.jpg|Mercedes Sosa File:Two pieces of grilled short ribs served on a plate, 2007.jpg|Asado File:Tango-Show-Buenos-Aires-01.jpg|Tango File:Pope Francis in March 2013 (cropped).jpg|Pope Francis File:Preparations for an argentinian asado 3.JPG|Chorizo File:Néstor Kirchner and Cristina Fernández.jpg|Néstor and Cristina Krichner File:Casa Rosada exterior from Plaza de Mayo.JPG|Casa Rosada File:CheHigh.jpg|Che Guevara ===Australia=== File:Koala and joey.jpg|Koala File:Kangaroo and joey03.jpg|Kangaroo File:NZ Lamington.jpg|Lamington File:Sydney Harbour Bridge from Circular Quay.jpg|Sydney Harbour Bridge File:Sydney opera house side view.jpg|Sydney Opera House File:Ned kelly day before execution photograph.jpg|Ned Kelly File:ACDC In Tacoma 2009.jpg|AC/DC File:Gilly Adam Gilchrist 100.jpg|Adam Gilchrist File:Steve Irwin.jpg|Steve Irwin File:Heath Ledger.jpg|Heath Ledger File:Kylie Minogue Cannes.jpg|Kylie Minogue File:Keith Urban on Walmart Soundcheck (5283413649).jpg|Keith Urban File:Nicole kidman3cropped.jpg|Nicole Kidman File:On Her Majesty's Secret Service (2).jpg|link=|George Lazenby File:Crocodile Dundee (7158357115) (cropped).jpg|Crocodile Dundee File:Petermann Ranges (AU), Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park, Uluru -- 2019 -- 3704-8.jpg|Ayers Rock File:Sydney (AU), Bondi Beach -- 2019 -- 2354.jpg|Bondi Beach File:GreatBarrierReef-EO.JPG|Great Barrier Reef File:Sydney skyline at dusk -
